bibl.note: This document is a letter dated June 21, 1844, from Dryald C. Whab to Adam Fergusson. Whab writes to warn Fergusson that some are accusing him of being the author of an anonymous newspaper article attacking the Whigs, and that some young men are seeking retribution for the insult.

div.p:
There is a great excitement in town this morning about the letter which appeared in last nights Union among the whigs. And they accu some of them Accuse you as being the author of it. They speak as if they intend to ask you about it and even make threats such as "If they knew the man &c &c et cetera they would make him swallow it or take a beating" so I thought it was as well to inform you of the feeling that exists in order that you might not be taken
by surprise_ If Violence is not intended Insult is_ this is among the young men however I will tell you all particulars when you come to town_ I will be out this evening should you not come to town before then
